name: quaintly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is attractive because of being unusual, and often old-fashioned: They work out at a quaintly dilapidated Los Angeles gym. The cafe tables quaintly spill into the street.
in a way that is old-fashioned and now considered strange: He explained what is sometimes quaintly called economic freedom. The notion of employer loyalty is quaintly risible. See
quaint
More examplesFewer examplesThe cottage was quaintly chilly and picturesque in winter. Movies that were outrageous in 1995 seem quaintly tame by comparison.an educational film made during the Cold War that quaintly assumes that hiding under a school desk would protect a child from an A-bomb
